label: ham
subject: Re: [SMB] NTCreateANDX quesiotn
body: In vulgar usage, a tyrant is a king who governs violently and without regard for justice and law. In the exact sense, a tyrant is an individual who arrogates to himself the royal authority without having a right to it. This is how the Greeks understood the word "tyrant": they applied it indifferently to good and bad princes whose authority was not legitimate.[2] _Tyrant_ and _usurper_ are thus perfectly synonymous terms.
